node.title: Victoria to overhaul sexual assault laws to require affirmative consent, outlaw 'stealthing'
node.description: An affirmative consent model will put the focusÂ on the accused person confirming they have received consent, rather than scrutinising the behaviour of the victim-survivor.
node.content:
["The Victorian government will introduce a requirement for affirmative consent, in response to recommendations from the Victorian Law Reform Commission's report into sexual violence and the justice system.", "The affirmative consent model means the focus is on the accused person confirming they have received consent, rather than scrutinising the behaviour of the victim-survivor.", "Attorney-General\u00a0Jaclyn Symes\u00a0said the system had\u00a0focused too much on the behaviour of victims.", "\"This will flip it,\" she said.", "\"This means the questions will be on the perpetrator: What did you do to ensure that you knew the person was consenting to sexual activity?\"", "The government will also amend laws to make \"stealthing\" explicitly\u00a0illegal.", "Stealthing is removing a condom during sex without the other person's knowledge or consent.", "Ms Symes said the government would develop a 10-year, whole-of-government strategy to address sexual offending.", "\"Those that are brave enough to report this conduct\u00a0often feel retraumatised by going through the justice system,\" she said.", "\"Whether it's the interaction with police on the first reporting, the interaction with the service providers and the questioning that goes along with that, and then of course any court proceedings and the trial process can be damaging for victims.", "\"We want to change that.\"", "
Advocates applaud changes
", "", "
Saxon Mullins is\u00a0pleased that affirmative content laws will be introduced in Victoria.(ABC News: Shaun Kingma)
", "Saxon Mullins from Rape and Sexual Assault Research and Advocacy, who is also a survivor of sexual assault, said the court process could often be a \"real re-traumatisation\" for victims, and reform was needed.", "\"Not only are you sharing such a horrible story, a really awful moment, again and again,\" she said.", "\"But you're also being subjected to really horrible ways of going about it, questioning your character and your truth.\"", "Earlier this year,\u00a0NSW introduced similar\u00a0affirmative consent laws, and Ms Mullins said these were a common-sense approach to sexual assault cases.", "\"It just makes sense that you would make it a law that you have to check,\" Ms Mullins said.", "\"If you want to say you had a reasonable belief that someone was consenting, you have to find out. You can't just assume based on silence.\"", "In a 654-page report, the Law Reform Commission called for greater investment in services for victims, and an option for restorative justice \u2014 where the victim and the person responsible work together.", "Among its 91 recommendations, the commission also called\u00a0for ways to make it easier for victim-survivors to report sexual violence, including a user-friendly website explaining what support was available, more ways to contact police and an Aboriginal sexual assault service.", "The report said more needed\u00a0to be done to encourage people to report sexual violence.", "\"People still do not talk openly about sexual violence,\" it said.", "\"They do not always know it is a crime, or how to reach out for support or to find justice. When a person discloses sexual violence, they do not always get a supportive response. These things are barriers to justice.\"", "The government said\u00a0it would\u00a0consider all the recommendations in detail, and consult widely.", "Legislation will be introduced in 2022."]
